text: The 2000 Paris–Roubaix was the 98th running of the Paris–Roubaix single-day cycling race, often known as the Hell of the North. It was held on 9 April 2000 over a distance of . These are the results for the 2000 edition of the Paris–Roubaix cycling classic, in which Johan Museeuw took his second Roubaix win. The year's race took place in warm and dry conditions but with strong winds. ==Results== 9-04-2000: Compiègne–Roubaix {| class="wikitable" style="width:45em;margin-bottom:0;" |+ Results (1–10) |- ! !Cyclist !Team !Time |- !style="text-align:center"| 1 | | |align=right| 6h 47' 00" |- !style="text-align:center"| 2 | | |align=right| + 15" |- !style="text- align:center"| 3 | | |align=right| + 15" |- !style="text-align:center"| 4 | | |align=right| + 15" |- !style="text-align:center"| 5 | | |align=right| + 15" |- !style="text-align:center"| 6 | | |align=right| + 15" |- !style="text- align:center"| 7 | | |align=right| + 15" |- !style="text-align:center"| 8 | | |align=right| + 15" |- !style="text-align:center"| 9 | | |align=right| + 21" |- !style="text-align:center"| 10 | | |align=right| + 1' 18" |} ==References== 2000 Category:2000 in road cycling Category:2000 in French sport Paris-Roubaix Category:April 2000 sports events in Europe
